devdoc.details: Implementation of the IERC1271 interface to support signature validation using a designated signer. This contract allows the management of a signer address, which can be updated by the contract owner (Nexera ID). It provides a mechanism to validate signatures according to EIP-1271, enabling the contract to act as an identity with the ability to authorize actions through off-chain signed messages.

constructor.details: Initializes the contract by setting the initial signer.

params.initialOwner: The address of the initial owner of the contract.
params.initialSigner: The address of the initial signer.

params.hash: The hash of the data signed.

returns._0: magicValue bytes4 constant `MAGIC_VALUE` if the signature is valid.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params.newSigner: The address of the new signer. Requirements: - The caller must be the contract owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

devdoc.title: NexeraID Signer Manager
